text: for more than nine thousand three
hundred years the shy ten volcano was a
sleeping beast residents of this town
which bears the same name say they
barely knew it existed that changed on
May second which I 10 erupted violently
sending a column of hot ash and gases
some 12 miles into the air shy 10
exploded with such force that some
scientists warned of a more damaging
eruption that could erase the town much
like Mount Vesuvius destroyed the Roman
city of Pompeii in AD 79 the initial
eruption spared Shaytan then less than
two weeks later the rains came swelling
with rainfall and volcanic material the
river here overflowed its banks a sea of
fallen trees and gray mud swept over the
town destroying half of Shaytan within a
few days today shy 10 is a ghost town a
bus stand suspended in time on a main
road buried up to its windows there is
no electricity or running water houses
are nearly filled to the roofs with gray
mud residents like Pedro Vasquez a
retired Army Colonel that moved here
eight years ago are still trying to
recover their belongings from there
buried homes note agartha yeah our house
is here with all this volcanic ash but
we're working to clean up we're going to
clean it because of the hope of
rebuilding our town but our town lives
it's alive it's hurt but our town is
still a lot
the government is wrestling with what to
do with shai 10 whether to rebuild or
move it safely away from the volcano shy
10 is still active complicating the
decisions of residents and the
government many of those who were
evacuated like John Delgado a cattle
rancher who is living with his wife
Loretta and four children in the city of
Port mamona want to go back when will
find said in someone well my plans would
hopefully be to return to my land to my
home I feel awful but who was there to
blame no one only nature sometime
internal device for him the pull of life
in the country is too strong necesitan
samanta Sierra they need their
mountaintops their fields their cows
these are things that well for an
outsider it wouldn't seem like such a
big deal but for them it's very
important Chile's government has reacted
to the tragedy by saying it would build
an early warning detection system to
measure seismic activities potentially
active volcanoes be doable but we can't
let our guard down as they say we must
vigilantly monitor the volcano because
one needs to be attentive and prepared
for any eventual reaction both sigh 10
is hardly the only town and faces the
threat of extinction there have been
more than 150 known eruptions with 30
different volcanoes in Chile since about
the year 1600
for sure 10 volcano experts say
it was only a matter of time before the
Beast awoke from its slumber
